instructions.title: How to use WhatsApp Link Generator

steps.title: Select your country code
steps.description: Click the country selector dropdown and choose the country for your WhatsApp number. You can search by country name, code, or dial prefix. The tool supports 50+ countries including US (+1), UK (+44), India (+91), Brazil (+55), and many more. The country code will be automatically added to your phone number.

steps.title: Enter the phone number
steps.description: Type the phone number without the country code or leading zeros. For example, if the full number is +39 333 1234567, just enter '333 1234567'. The tool accepts spaces and dashes for readability but removes them automatically when generating the link.

steps.title: Add a pre-filled message (optional)
steps.description: Write a message that will appear pre-filled when someone clicks your link. This is perfect for standard inquiries, support requests, or promotional messages. Use the Templates button to quickly insert common business messages like product inquiries, appointment requests, or support tickets.

steps.title: Generate your WhatsApp link
steps.description: Click 'Generate WhatsApp Link' to create your click-to-chat URL. The tool will validate your phone number and create a properly formatted wa.me link. If you included a message, it will be URL-encoded and appended to the link automatically.

steps.title: Copy, download, or test your link
steps.description: Use the generated link by copying it to clipboard, downloading as a text file, or clicking 'Open WhatsApp' to test it directly. Download the QR code for print materials, business cards, or store displays. The mobile preview shows exactly how your message will appear to recipients.

troubleshooting: Link doesn't open WhatsApp: Ensure WhatsApp is installed on the device. On desktop, WhatsApp Web must be set up.
Invalid phone number error: Remove any leading zeros and enter only digits. Country code is added automatically.
Message not appearing: Check that special characters are properly encoded. Avoid using certain symbols.
QR code not scanning: Ensure good lighting and hold phone 6-8 inches from the code. Try downloading and printing larger.
Wrong country selected: Search for your country by name or dial code in the dropdown selector.
Link works on mobile but not desktop: WhatsApp Web must be logged in on the desktop browser.
Message too long: WhatsApp pre-filled messages have a 4096 character limit. Shorten your message.
Chat opens with wrong number: Double-check the phone number format and country code selection.
